WorkspaceSelector.AreYouSure:
Are you sure you want to remove this workspace? 
Removing the workspace will delete the workspace in this application, but will not delete the folders from the hard drive. 
But, if you choose to delete the Wiki folder as well, all contents will be deleted.
WorkspaceSelector.RemoveWorkspaceAndDelete: Remove workspace and delete Wiki folder from the disk

AddWorkspace.NewSubWikiDoneButton: <0><0>Use</0><1>{{wikiFolderLocation}}</1></0><1>As new Wiki folder</1><2>, and link to main Wiki</2>
AddWorkspace.CloneSubWikiDoneButton: <0><0>Use</0><1>{{wikiFolderLocation}}</1></0><1>As cloned Wiki folder</1><2>, and link to main Wiki</2>
AddWorkspace.MainWorkspaceDescription: Contains TiddlyWiki's configuration files and public content when published as a blog.
AddWorkspace.SubWorkspaceDescription:
It must be attached to a main repository, which can be used to store private content, synchronized to a private Github repository, and can only be read and written by itself. 
The sub-knowledge base takes effect by creating a soft link (shortcut) to the main knowledge base. After the link is created, the content in the sub-knowledge base can be seen in the main knowledge base.
AddWorkspace.SwitchCreateNewOrOpenExisted: Switch to create a new or open an existing WIKI
AddWorkspace.CanNotLoadList: Can't load repository list, network connection is not good.
AddWorkspace.OmitMoreResult: The list only shows the first {{loadCount}} results
AddWorkspace.WikiServerPort: WIKI server port number (change if there is a conflict, generally the default is OK)
AddWorkspace.WorkspaceFolderNameToCreate: The name of the new workspace folder
AddWorkspace.CreateLinkFromSubWikiToMainWikiSucceed: The shortcut to the sub-wiki is successfully created in the main Wiki, and the shortcut that saves the file in the main Wiki will automatically save the file in the sub-Wiki.
AddWorkspace.StartUsingTemplateToCreateWiki: Start creating a wiki with templates
AddWorkspace.ThisPathIsNotAWikiFolder: The directory is not a Wiki folder "{{wikiPath}}"
AddWorkspace.WikiExisted: Wiki already exists at this location "{{newWikiPath}}"
AddWorkspace.WorkspaceUpdated: The workspace is updated and the Wiki is being launching

EditWorkspace.Hibernate: Save CPU usage, memory and battery.

Dialog.CantFindWorkspaceFolderRemoveWorkspace:
Cannot find the workspace folder that was still there before! 
The folders that should have existed here may have been removed! 
Do you want to remove the workspace?
Dialog.NeedCorrectTiddlywikiFolderPath: The correct path needs to be passed in, and this path cannot be recognized by TiddlyWiki.
Dialog.PathPassInCantUse: The path passed in cannot be used
Dialog.GithubUserInfoNoFoundDetail: Seems you haven't login to Github, so we disable syncing for this wiki.

Log.CantSyncGitNotInitialized: Unable to sync, this folder is not initialized as a Git repository
Log.CantSyncInSpecialGitStateAutoFixFailed: Unable to Sync, this folder is in special condition, thus can't Sync directly. An auto-fix has been tried, but error still remains. Please resolve all the conflict manually (For example, use VSCode to open the wiki folder), if this still don't work out, please use professional Git tools (Source Tree, GitKraken) to solve this.
Log.CantSyncInSpecialGitStateAutoFixSucceed: This folder is in a special state, it could not be synchronized directly, but it has been automatically repaired
Log.CantSynchronizeAndSyncScriptIsInDeadLoop: Unable to sync, and Sync script is in a dead loop.
Log.GitMergeFailed: Git merge results are not good, there may be loopholes in the merge strategy
Log.GitPushFailed: Git push result is bad, this usually means there is a network issue.
Log.GitRepositoryConfigurateFailed: Git repository configuration failed, see error log for details
Log.HaveThingsToCommit: There is content that needs to be submitted (commit), and it is being submitted automatically
Log.StartGitInitialization: Start initializing the local Git repository
Log.LocalAheadStartUpload: The local state is ahead of the cloud, and the upload starts
Log.LocalStateBehindSync: Local state is behind of the cloud, start merging data from the cloud.
Log.LocalStateDivergeRebase: The local state is divergent from the cloud and begins to rebase (Rebase)
Log.NoNeedToSync: No need to synchronize, the local state is consistent with the cloud
Log.PerformLastCheckBeforeSynchronizationFin: Perform the final check before synchronization ends
Log.PrepareCloneOnlineWiki: Preparing to clone an online wiki.
Log.PrepareSync: Prepare to synchronize, use the logged-in author information
Log.RebaseConflictNeedsResolve: Found conflict when performing git Rebase, need to resolve the conflict.
Log.StartBackupToGithubRemote: The local Git where the Wiki is located is being backed up to the Github remote repository. The time required depends on the internet speed, please be patient
Log.StartConfiguringGithubRemoteRepository: After the repository is initialized, start to configure the Github remote repository
Log.StartFetchingFromGithubRemote: Fetching data from the remote Github repository, The time required depends on the internet speed, please be patient.
Log.SyncFailedSystemError: Synchronization failed, there may be a problem with the synchronization system
Log.SynchronizationFailed:
Sync failed! 
You need to use tools such as Github Desktop to check the status of the current Git repository. 
The failure may be caused by the network. If this is the case, you can try again after adjusting the network.
Log.UsingUrlAndUsername: Using Git Url {{githubRepoUrl}} with username {{username}} and accessToken {{accessToken}}

Preference.SyncIntervalDescription: After there is no new change for more than this length of time, it will automatically start backing up to Github (take effect after restart app)
